title: Gel DNA Recovery
original description: This is a protocol for high yield recovery of pure DNA from agarose gels, using GeneJET Gel Extraction and DNA Cleanup Micro Kit
steps:
None
1. Excise up to 200 mg gel slice containing the DNA fragment using a clean scalpel or razor blade. Cut as close to the DNA as possible to minimize the gel volume. Place the gel slice into a 1.5 mL tube.
2. Add 200 µL of Extraction Buffer. Mix thoroughly by pippeting.
3. Incubate the gel mixture at 50-58°C for 10 minutes or until the gel slice is completely dissolved. Mix the tube by inversion every few minutes to facilitate the melting process. Ensure that the gel is completely dissolved 
600s
4. Add 200 µL of ethanol (96-100%) and mix by pipetting.
5. Transfer the mixture to the DNA Purification Micro Column preassembled with a collection tube. Centrifuge the column for 1 minute at 14,000 × g. Discard the flow-through. Place the DNA Purification Micro Column back into the collection tube. 
60s
6. Add 200 µL of Prewash Buffer (supplemented with ethanol, see p. 3) to the DNA Purification Micro Column and centrifuge for 1 minute at 14,000 × g. Discard the flow-through and place the purification column back into the collection tube. 
200amount 
60s
7. Add 700 µL of Wash Buffer (supplemented with ethanol, see p. 3) to the DNA Purification Micro Column and centrifuge for 1 minute at 14,000 × g. Discard the flow-through and place the purification column back into the collection tube. 
60s
8. Repeat step 7 
200amount 
60s
9. Centrifuge the empty DNA Purification Micro Column for an additional 1 minute at 14,000 × g to completely remove residual Wash Buffer. 
60s
10. Transfer the DNA Purification Micro Column into a clean 1.8 mL microcentrifuge
tube 
6amount
11. Add 10 µL of Elution Buffer to the DNA Purification Micro Column. Centrifuge for 1 minute at 14,000 × g to elute DNA. 
60s
ai_generated_description: The objective of this protocol is to recover and purify DNA fragments from an agarose gel using the GeneJET Gel Extraction and DNA Cleanup Micro Kit. The procedure includes careful excision of the gel slice, several centrifuge steps for purification, and DNA elution for high yield recovery of the DNA.
